website_summaries.verdict: Simple design that is easy to use. Leather and metal components deliver longevity.
pros: Uses a 34-inch steel chain to support and secure any weights you wish to add for workouts
Leather belt should give you nice performance levels over the long haul
Nothing fancy in this design, but it does the intended job well, thanks to the quality materials in use
cons: No padding to protect your hips from the leather digging in

customer_reviews.title: Performed as expected
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why everyone is claiming that it's cheaply built, but I've done pullups on these with (2)45lb plates strapped on with no problem. The chains feel sturdy as is any other part of its construction. However, I find it fitting too big on me, although I have a 26" waist, so I have to secure the end loops with a padlock
customer_reviews.author: yarrh

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY SAFETY HAZARD!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The pieces of the belt are being held into place by cheap rivets. It broke on me after I put in down with a 100lbs on the belt, had it done this while I was wearing the belt, it could have caused great injury. PS. it's made in PAKISTAN, and everyone knows that PAKISTAN is renowned for their fine craftsmanship. My excellent Pakistani dip belt broke after THREE uses. WOW. You'd think with all the aid we give them, they could hire some decent workers. Bravo to HARBINGER, great job on ruining your name, will never buy anything produced by that company again.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Broke with 25lbs on it...
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend buying this belt. The grommets are not the advertised steel and are a very light metal... perhaps tin. Before my first set of pull-ups... I placed 25lbs on it and I was walking over to my pull up bar. The grommets all came out and the weight almost broke my foot. For $40 ... this belt is terrible. Even a nylon belt can hold 25lbs...
customer_reviews.author: StephanieHope

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Weight/Dip Belt
customer_reviews.text: great quality, great price. I use it all the time for weighted dips and pull-ups. the leather is great quality, it does not tear, crease/bend or scratch. I highly recommend all of Harbinger's leather belts.
customer_reviews.author: AlfamaN10

customer_reviews.title: Broke on the way to the gym...
customer_reviews.text: The day I got this, I was walking to the gym. Started to bend the leather to break it in a little, and when I was almost to the middle portion and started bending it around the rivets, all three popped out and completely separated, leaving me with a completely useless belt. Returned it and will either get a different brand or a synthetic one.
customer_reviews.author: BDS

customer_reviews.title: great belt
customer_reviews.text: the belt works well. it can hold more than two 45lb plates. a lot of the belts on amazon have questions about chain length, and this chain is long enough. it could probably stand to be a little longer, and the chain a little denser. my only complaint might be that the slide hook is not as easy to use as a normal hook, which isn't that big of a deal, but when you are putting a lot of weight on there it can be a little frustrating trying to open the key to slide the hook in.
customer_reviews.author: the overmouth

customer_reviews.title: Caution: Extremely sharp carabiner snap gate.
customer_reviews.text: Caution: carabiner snap link gate extremely sharp. Managed to cut hand, shirt and torso while unloading 25lbs. Issue can be remedied by replacing carabiner with smooth gate carabiner (~1.50 inches wide). Or opt to wear gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart after a month
customer_reviews.text: Three of the 10 metal rivets holding this belt together have popped off in the first month of use. I'm hanging between 25lbs and 45lbs from it depending on exercise and there's no excuse for this shoddy construction. I had an APC belt that easily handled 90lbs. Terribly disappointed and Amazon is telling me that I can no longer return it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles B. Cain

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy, waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I used this maybe four times holding two 25lb. plates, for 50lbs total. The bolts snapped loose and while I wasn't hurt, it was clear this is a cheap piece of crap. Not recommended at all.
customer_reviews.author: Colte94

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad belt, but not the best...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this belt a few weeks back. I was excited to begin using it. Unfortunately within one week of receiving the belt it broke. Two of the rivets connecting the leather pieces popped out while in use. I had two plates between my legs, and thankfully the third rivet did not give way. I think this is a fine belt, and will have it re-riveted. Hopefully this is not something that occurs on a regular basis.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Steffen

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: A little stiff and ended up tearing at seam after a couple uses with 90 pounds strapped to it.
customer_reviews.author: Greg corry

customer_reviews.title: my dip belt went to the garbage.
customer_reviews.text: This belt broke after three weeks with only 95 pounds. Everyone says that they had problems with the rivets, but mine ripped the actual belt in half . I would say skip this belt and go for a nice fabric belt.
customer_reviews.author: Jase S.

customer_reviews.title: Boom
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. A lot of people forget that writes dips and pull ups are a great way to build power. Spend the money and get the leather belt instead of cheaper versions.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Trevino

customer_reviews.title: Not the best build
customer_reviews.text: I had this belt for about 4 months and it has already failed. I had been using it for weighted pull-ups and dips (never more than 45lbs at once). 3 Rivets came out almost at once. Thankfully Amazon CS is great and sent me a new one. Lets see how the new one does.
customer_reviews.author: hockeyguy1721

customer_reviews.title: Defective Dip Belt! Broke after one use! save your money.
customer_reviews.text: This product broke the same day I used it (with merely one 45lbs plate.
customer_reviews.author: Allan K Salinas

customer_reviews.title: Dip belt
customer_reviews.text: Belt is well made / heavy duty and comfortable. I've used it multiple times. Some have complained about the chain length being too short. It may be if you are using 45lbs weights. 35lb and less are no problem. You can always use multiple weights to acheive the total desired. I purposely bought it because of the short chain comments for ground clearance reasons. The only issue I have is the clasp. It doesn't look like it will hold up long term(bad spring). Eventually I will have to get a new one from Home Depot.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Rivets popped out on 2nd use
customer_reviews.text: The 2nd time I used this belt I had about 55 lbs on it and two of the rivets popped out. That is absolutely ridiculous. There is a major design flaw with this belt and Harbinger should just pull the product as it is completely useless...
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Pruitt

customer_reviews.title: Great Stuff!!
customer_reviews.text: The Best price I found online for a leather dip belt was here on amazon. Its very resistant. Great chain. So far I've tried a 45lbs plate with it and have no problems. I dont know if it could hold up 2 plates of 45lbs; I Haven't tried that yet, but I think it can do that heavy job too.
customer_reviews.author: M. Arevalo

customer_reviews.title: The chain is long enough.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this belt for about a month now and have had no problems with it. I searched Amazon for the right belt before I picked this one, but the reviews for almost every belt said that the chain was too short. This chain is just fine. I have had 2 plates on it so far, but I doubt I'll have any trouble getting 3 on, or even 4 if I need to. But I'm a pretty thin guy (my pants are a 32-34 inch waist). If you are larger, then you might have issues with chain length.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick J. Septon

customer_reviews.title: DOES THE JOB WELL
customer_reviews.text: GREAT BELT, THE ONLY IMPROVEMENT WOULD BE TO HAVE A LARGER CLIP....I HAD TO BUY ONE FROM WALMART (99 CENTS) NO BIGGY....OVERALL DOES THE JOB WELL
customer_reviews.author: MR_RED708

customer_reviews.title: Pretty darn good
customer_reviews.text: I just got this belt last week. It is quite nice. I can confirm that it can hold 2 45 pound plates pretty easily. You may need to get the chain extended to go for a 3rd plate though.
customer_reviews.author: W. Vaughan

customer_reviews.title: Belt
customer_reviews.text: I did alot of research for a good dip belt. Tried using a couple different belts and found this Harbinger leather belt to be the best by far!
customer_reviews.author: Mattsxbscion

customer_reviews.title: Cheap construction for good belt price
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a grizzly dip belt off of amazon and this belt arrived in its place. At a glance it looked like a really nice belt. But once I removed it from the box two of the rivets fell out of the plastic that the belt came wrapped in. The belt never even made it to the gym! Don't waste your time with this belt. I recommend grizzly's dip belt.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

product_meta.title: Harbinger Leather Dip Belt with 30-Inch Steel Chain
product_meta.description: Expand your weight training routine with the Harbinger Leather Dip Belt. The contoured design of this belt provides back and upper body support, fitting comfortably during serious training. The 30-inch steel chain and carabineer mechanism allow weight to easily be added for chin-ups and dips helping to develop power and strength in triceps and chest. The Harbinger Leather Dip Belt features one piece all leather construction with heavy duty steel grommets to secure chain to belt for maximum durability. Adjustable, one size fits all.
feature_bullets: Dip belt constructed of one continuous piece of genuine leather and heavy duty steel grommets to secure chain to belt
Contoured belt design provides back support and fits comfortably during serious training
30-inch steel chain and carabiner mechanism to easily add weight for chin-ups and dips
Weighted dip belt helps build power and strength in triceps and chest

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
